Responsibilities        Works mainly without supervision; refers upwards as necessary     Monitors budgets and controlling expenditure to meet financial targets for own areas     Promotes innovation     Sets and meets agreed deadlines     Allocates tasks and coordinates activities     Represents the group / office / discipline / profession internally and externally     Authors official documents e.g., letters and reports for internal or external use         May, in addition, be responsible for one or more of the following:         Manages projects, work area, or technical skill set     Predicts and plans future resources which may include setting up new projects and project plans     Designs or delivers events, activities, processes, and/or projects which have a major impact on the management of the business     Oversees performance and development of others, providing guidance, training, and motivational and directional feedback           Qualifications        A Bachelors degree in Electrical Building Services Engineering from an appropriate education institute, or equivalent qualification or sufficient experience     Experience in data centre design is critical for this role         Developing skills, knowledge, and experience           Taking the initiative in developing self and career; continuously assessing own abilities and aspirations, and evaluates them against suitable development and career opportunities within Black & White; fostering the long-term learning and development of others, and has a focus on the development intent and effect rather than on the formal role of training; striving to advance technical skills which differentiate Black & White from competitors; and demonstrating skill and technical competence in the discipline             Commits to own and others continuing professional development     Actively develops the knowledge, experience, and skills of others, including those in other groups or offices e.g., acts as a mentor or coach, delivers training events, etc.     Being sought out by others within and outside Black & White for their professional and technical expertise     Supports the technical committee and drives or leads on technical initiatives     Brings wide and varied experience to their professional or technical area e.g., experience in working in different locations     Promotes quality of delivery; strives to get it right first time, every time         Planning and Organising         Identifying objectives clearly, planning actions, allocating tasks, and monitoring progress; coordinating with and informing others as necessary; having the ability to juggle different conflicting demands and priorities; and ensuring delivery is planned to include sufficient time for QA or QC.     Adopts simplicity in approach to problems and solutions     Liaises with other teams, the customer, and other external partners to organise everyone s time efficiently     Makes significant changes in own area to meet strategic needs     Is realistic about own and others capabilities     Ensures people have the investment/resources/training they need to carry out their jobs and projects     Switches quickly between different levels of thinking to be able to stand back and see the big picture     Runs meetings efficiently, issues agendas in good time, ensures subjects are covered and actions taken         Thinking and Decision Making         Analytical, creative, and conceptual thinking; the ability to evaluate options, consider the consequences and implications, reach conclusions, and make recommendations and decisions.     Deals with complex escalated problems within own area     Creates new or better operational processes     Makes time to review projects to identify and learn from successes and problems     Thinks beyond the immediate task in hand and considers the impact of decisions further down the line     Challenges existing working practices and suggests improvements     Identifies patterns and trends and recommends action     Provides in-depth analysis of problems and proposes solutions     Brings others in to contribute to solutions     Fosters the development of new ideas in others         Commercial Awareness and Acumen         Understanding the importance of financial success and the willingness or ability to act in the interest of achieving it; negotiating the best terms for Black & White; managing legal and contractual aspects; and desiring to work efficiently, as time is money.     Ensures Black & White competes effectively through a thorough understanding of external market conditions (fees, scope of service, conditions)     Includes contingency allowances in negotiated fees/costs/budgets     Benchmarks fees or costs against market rates     Works to minimise costs and risks, and maximise income     Demonstrates good commercial judgement, evaluating risks and making recommendations to reject commercially unattractive opportunities     Negotiates most favourable contractual and financial terms and conditions with customers or suppliers     Considers alternative fee structures, minimizes or caps the liability of Black & White in any agreement     Knows what the One Global Team approach can offer and promotes this to the customers     Understands Black & White s financial bidding processes and complies with them     Delegates work to achieve best value     Tenaciously chases cash for own projects         Building Customer/Client Relationships         The desire to delight customers (may be other individuals or offices within Black & White) by concentrating on discovering, understanding, and satisfying needs; networking, bringing people, opportunities, and activities together; and arranging win/win solutions.     Acts with integrity, is straight-talking, respectful, and fair     Liaises with customers, keeps them informed, seeks feedback, listens to complaints and praise, manages expectations, and responds appropriately     Keeps in touch with customers between projects     Tailors service offered to customers needs (real and perceived)     Is firm with customers when appropriate without causing unnecessary confrontation     Identifies influencers and decision makers     Thinks of how a person can be of value to other people they know     Invests own time in fostering relationships with external business associates     Proactively looks for potential issues and activities in terms of public relations         Communication         Receiving, interpreting, and imparting information and ideas, both written and spoken, to a wide range of people, influencing others.     Uses every means (visual aids, working models, etc.) to make presentations exciting and interesting     Identifies the key issues and communicates them concisely and simply     Uses language appropriate to the audience e.g., does not use technical or professional jargon when communicating with people from different disciplines or professions     Adapts communication to other cultural styles     Asks questions to ensure others have understood what they need to do     Explains complex concepts in simple terms     Persuades through debate and logical argument in a non- adversarial way     When appropriate, tells people honestly and positively things they don t want to know     Communicates appropriately sensitive and confidential matters between staff     Mediates disagreements between parties and negotiates work that compromises the benefit of all         Teamwork and Leadership         Working in a group in a complementary fashion, which when effective, produces a holistic solution; liaising and cooperating with others; and being aware of own and others strengths and weaknesses.     Treats everyone with respect, irrespective of their level, background, gender, or discipline or profession     Supports others, even when they have made mistakes     Identifies and actions training needs (own and others)     Motivates without formal authority e.g., initiatives spanning across several groups     Spots when tasks or projects are going off the rails and intervenes or assists in good time     Deals with people s issues fairly and consistently     Strengthens team by incorporating specialists     Incorporates existing staff into the team even if they have less than an ideal profile     Actively supports and implements business or management systems           Our Values         Accountability: Everyone is accountable.     Integrity: We are straight-talking, respectful, and fair.     Simplicity: Both in our approach and solutions.     Supportive: We are approachable, inclusive, and we recognise success. column2: As an Electrical Site Engineer, your role is to oversee and manage electrical construction projects at various sites     You will be responsible for ensuring that electrical systems are installed, operated, and maintained correctly and in accordance with project specifications and safety standards       Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:       Project Planning and Design: Collaborate with project managers, architects, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and develop electrical system plans and designs     This includes determining electrical load requirements, cable routing, equipment placement, and electrical distribution design     Installation Supervision: Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of electrical systems and equipment on-site     Coordinate with electrical contractors and ensure compliance with design specifications, safety codes, and industry standards     Quality Assurance: Perform regular inspections and quality checks to ensure that electrical work is being carried out according to approved plans and standards     Identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies, ensuring that electrical systems are installed correctly and functioning properly     Safety Compliance: Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site     Ensure that electrical installations meet safety codes and regulations, and address any safety concerns promptly     Project Coordination: Coordinate with other trades and disciplines on-site to ensure proper integration and coordination of electrical systems with other construction activities     Communicate effectively with project teams and provide technical guidance as needed     Material and Equipment Management: Plan and manage the procurement, delivery, and storage of electrical materials, equipment, and tools required for the project     Ensure that inventory is maintained, and proper documentation is maintained for materials used

Working closely with the supply chain and performing technical bid analysis of their designs. Key Accountability  2  Electrical engineering design of project solutions of time   Electrical design associated with water & Wastewater treatment plants   Design of control, monitoring and telemetry systems  Design of instrumentation systems  Design of main incoming electrical supply systems  Design of electrical installation systems (including hazardous areas)  Key Accountability 3  Health & Safety Excellence of time  Support the Electrical Discipline Head in the drive towards excellence in H&S, demonstrating applied knowledge & skills to produce safe designs to discharge your obligation according to CDM Regulations, standards and accepted codes of practice. OR        2.0 Power System Engineer:      A candidate shall be conversant with Power System Analysis Software and Power System Studies such as Short circuit, load flow, relay setting and relay coordination, transient stability, arc flash studies etc. Hands-on experience with ETAP software shall be preferred.      OR        3.0 Field Testing and Commissioning Engineer:      A candidate shall have field experience in EHV-HV-MV Power system Equipment, including Power System protection, Testing Commissioning or Condition Monitoring Testing. This is an ON and OFF, On-site execution job.      OR        4.0 CMD Testing:      Candidates shall have experience in Condition Monitoring Testing of the majority of Power equipment. Candidates shall know the analysis and acceptability of Test results. This is an ON and OFF On-site job execution.        5.0    The candidate is expected to work in any one or more than one business activity of the organization depending upon experience, skills and proficiency.        6.0    Candidate shall have experience in either Power Plants, Petro-chemical, Oil & Gas plants, AL-CU smelters, Cement plants or any consulting engineers or service providers. column2: Job Title: Electrical Engineer Company Overview:   :  Greencentric Commercial projects is a leading turnkey interior  firm specializing in creating innovative and functional spaces for both commercial and residential clients. With a focus on excellence and creativity, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional design solutions that exceed our clients' expectations. Job Overview:  As an Electrical Engineer at Greencentric Commercial Projects, you will play a vital role in the design, implementation, and management of electrical systems for our projects. Your expertise in 2D drafting, AutoCAD, and electrical engineering principles will be instrumental in ensuring the successful completion of our projects on time and within budget. Key Responsibilities: 2D Drafting:  Proficient in AutoCAD 2D to create accurate technical drawings, schematics, and layouts for electrical systems. SLD (Single Line Diagram) Preparation:  Develop SLDs to illustrate the electrical connections and components. Lighting Layout Preparation:  Design lighting layouts for interior and exterior spaces, ensuring optimal illumination and energy efficiency. As-Built Drawing Preparation:  Prepare as-built drawings based on actual site conditions, documenting any modifications or deviations from the original design. Site Visits:  Conduct regular site visits to oversee electrical installations, verify compliance with design specifications, and address any on-site issues or changes. Bill of Quantities (BOQ) Preparation:  Create detailed BOQs outlining the quantities and specifications of electrical materials and equipment required for each project. Bill Verification and On-Site Bill Preparation:  Review contractor bills and invoices, verify the accuracy of charges, and prepare on-site bills as necessary. Certification and Verification of Vendor Bills:  Certify and verify vendor bills for electrical materials and services provided, ensuring adherence to contractual agreements and project budgets. Estimation and Costing:  Estimate the costs associated with electrical installations, including materials, labor, and overhead expenses. MS Excel Proficiency:  Utilize MS Excel for data analysis, cost tracking, and project management purposes. Efficient Client Communication:  Maintain effective communication with clients, contractors, and project stakeholders to provide updates, address concerns, and ensure client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle. Qualifications: Diploma in Electrical Engineering (Junior Engineer) or BE Electrical (Senior Engineer) from a recognized institution. Proven experience (2-5 years) working as an Electrical Engineer in the construction or engineering industry. Strong knowledge of electrical engineering principles, codes, and standards. Proficiency in AutoCAD 2D and other relevant design software. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently. Proficiency in MS Excel and other Microsoft Office applications. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Location:  Andheri East, Marol, Mumbai Benefits: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications. Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. Collaborative and supportive work environment with a focus on innovation and growth. Join Greencentric Commercial Projects and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to delivering exceptional electrical engineering solutions. Apply now to embark on an exciting career as an Electrical Engineer!

column2: The Principal electrical engineer will manage team of designers and engineers to create world class design on a variety of projects from concept design through completion of construction. Project focus would be data centers and telecommunications facilities but could include a variety of other facilities including pharmaceutical, biotechnology, healthcare, manufacturing, airports, or institutional facilities in the US. Specific areas of responsibility include the following:      1. Designs electrical systems/equipment to provide a useful and safe environment for the mission critical market in accordance with the clients requirements for reliability and uptime.      2. Advises clients regarding electrical systems/requirements available to meet their needs and comply with all applicable codes.      3. Review the drawing in terms of design and installation of equipment/systems to ensure compliance with design documents      4. Conducts fault studies and load flow analysis. Develop design criteria for protective device coordination, relay applications, medium voltage transformers, switchgear, medium and low voltage distribution.      5. Able to develop and/or lead the design of electrical master plans for facilities encompassing but not limited to the following: reliable power distribution, motor control centers, energy efficient lighting systems, communications and telecom routing, instrumentation and controls for HVAC systems, fire-alarm interface, building level uninterrupted power systems (UPS) systems, engine generators.      6. Reviews electrical designs and specifications of equipment or systems being purchased or fabricated.      7. Provides electrical design direction and resource management on multi-discipline projects      8. Developing concept studies, designs, and narratives.      9. Develop, guide, and coordinate design workflows, processes, and procedures.      10. Build relationships and coordinate with Section and Department Managers as well as Project Managers in other global practices and other office locations.      11. Participate in the Identification, recruiting and management of resources to meet the needs of the business      12. All other duties as assigned        Qualifications        1. Certifications / Skills:      a. Possess knowledge of all applicable standards and codes      b. AutoCAD, BIM (Revit), ETAP/SKM and Strong computer skills necessary to accomplish electrical designs.      c. Strong written and verbal communication skills.      2. Minimum Education: a. Bachelor of Electrical Engineering from a recognized institute.      3. Minimum Experience: a. 10 years of experience in the design, installation and maintenance of electrical distribution systems. b. A working knowledge of control systems and fundamental communication interfaces c. Demonstrated abilities as a project lead d. Industrial, Chemical & Petrochemical and Data center or telecommunication facility experience e. Knowledge of critical facility design and infrastructure

column2: As member of TK-NCA Erection & Commissioning Hub, the Electrical & Instrumentation (E&I) Supervisor, will assist the Site Management Team to execute E&I works on Green Hydrogen and Chlor-Alkali plants, from the Erection phase till final plant Commissioning & Start-Up     Specifically, you will have to deal with the following activities:     In the Office or WFH : Review site project work package: SoW, Site Instructions, Installation manuals, Risks Analysis & Safety plans ensuring all works are in line with the company standards and Client specification     Study project documentation, prepare detail report about changes made on site and cooperate to the engineering offices     Define, in conjunction with Project Manager and Commissioning Manager the Erection strategy and the associated schedule ensuring they adhere to contractual     At site: Inspect and evaluate status of delivered items and proactively identify potential issues, and promptly report them to the appropriate stakeholders.     Work closely with the project team to develop effective solutions and ensure timely resolution of problems.     Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements, safety protocols, and company policies pertaining to E&I installation (Certificates, Areas classification, LOTO, Interlock etc)     Manage the installation and testing of the Electrical system (HT/LT/MV/LV / Transformers & Rectifiers) and Instrumentation ensuring they operate effectively, efficiently and safely     Ensure compliance with Factory / Site ITP and perform FAT & SAT     Supervision of calibration, functional check, Loop check, Maintenance and respective testing on the equipment     Trouble shooting of E&I system and Softwares with resolution with items suppliers and engineering team, if required.     Perform system walk-down, line check and punch-listing (Clearing and Closure)     Supervise installation of PLC, DCS, ESD, Hardware, Software, Power supply and associated networks.     Prepare regular technical reports, maintain accurate documentation, and update relevant records.     Provide guidance and support to NCA team on-site, fostering a positive work environment and promoting skills development.     Ensure safety throughout all activities in the workplace (On Field as well as in the Vendors facilities).     Open the work permit (if applicable) and promote risk assessment within NCA team     Be the focal point for E&I activities of NCA on site towards client (Liaising between Engineering, Site Management and Sub-Contractors).     Responsible to ensure proper documentation and reporting of related activities (Progress reports, Punch List, Testing, etc);     Be involved and participate in client, vendor, and/or subcontractor meetings to resolve issues;     Lead and direct all E&I team of NCA members and Vendors     Work in close coordination with Site Manager and Commissioning Manager to assure a smooth execution of the scheduled activities     Instruct the NCA / Subcontractors team members;     Take decision on daily basis to guarantee a smooth schedule progression;     In coordination with Site & Project Management, negotiate and agree with the client on any change related to Installation topics;     Resolve technical issues or disputes, if in the interest of overall project management or the decision violates contractual, safety or quality requirements.         The ideal candidate must satisfy the following requirements :           Strong Electrical and/or Instrumentation erection supervision background       Basic education qualification is : Completed university studies as a associate degree or comparable degree     Previous experience in closely related position from 10 years minimum of specific experience as Supervisor in Construction, Oil & Gas or Chemical industry, Power Plants (Experience in Electrolysis will be a plus);     Previous experience managing work crews and teams with a blend of different cultures and nationalities is considered as a plus     Experience in Pre-commissioning & Commissioning as well as validation of respective systems in the industry (Chemical, Oil & Gas preferred)     Experience in interpreting electrical, instrumentation and controls installation plans, single line diagram, block diagrams, process-electric-pneumatic hook-up, loop diagrams, P&ID & construction drawings     Repair all type of process instrumentation and distributed control systems/equipment     Work with HT/LT/MV/LV and 3 phase power and equipment controls     Manage sub-contractors and monitor progress and reporting     Fluent in English both verbal and written (German, Italian or/and other European languages are a plus);     Availability to travel on prolonged stay at site in India & abroad (focus Middle-East, US and Europe);     High attention to HSE topics and procedures;     Capability to manage stressful situations;     Practical approach with troubleshooting and problem solving;     Knowledge of the IT tools: MS Office, Design softwares (ie AutoCAD, Navisworks, etc), MS Project

column2: Company: THM Huade Hydraulics Pvt Ltd About Us: At THM Huade Hydraulics, we are at the forefront of hydraulic component innovation and quality. Evolving from a family-run business, we are on a mission to establish THM as a globally recognized and independent brand in the hydraulics industry. Our commitment is to provide top-tier hydraulic solutions with a focus on both mobile and industrial applications. Role Overview: We are seeking an experienced Servo Sales & Service Engineer with expertise in industrial hydraulics and a strong orientation towards Servo Sales & Service. The ideal candidate will have extensive industry connections and a track record of fostering service relationships and developing business opportunities. Key Responsibilities: 4-6 years of experience in installation. Commissioning & maintenance of Tablet Compression Machines, pharmaceuticals equipment for solid oral dosage and related accessories. Should have in depth knowledge of installation, commissioning & maintenance of the machineries with electrical/instrumentation, pneumatic controls & should have exposure on mechanical erection activities. Knowledge with PLC operated machineries will be added advantage. Must have to troubleshoot & resolve issues Should be able read & understand mechanical drawings, plant layout, GA drawings of equipment, P&ID diagram, Utility schedule, Electrical schematic drawing etc. Knowledge of ATEX hazardous locations is desirable but not required. column2: Role & responsibilities     Electrical Site Engineers play a crucial role in construction projects, especially those involving significant electrical work. They ensure that all electrical installations and systems are designed, implemented, and maintained according to specifications, codes, and standards. Heres a detailed look at the roles and responsibilities of an Electrical Site Engineer: Project Planning and Design Review and Interpretation : Analyze project plans and specifications to understand electrical requirements. Review and interpret electrical diagrams, blueprints, and other technical documents. Design Oversight : Oversee or assist in the design of electrical systems, ensuring they meet project requirements, safety standards, and regulatory compliance. Implementation and Execution Site Supervision : Supervise the installation of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, fire alarm systems, and other related components. Coordination : Work closely with other engineers, architects, and construction team members to ensure electrical systems are integrated smoothly with other aspects of the construction project. Quality Assurance : Conduct quality control checks to ensure that the installation of electrical systems adheres to plans, specifications, codes, and safety standards. Material Management : Manage and procure electrical materials and equipment, ensuring they are available when needed and meet project specifications. Safety and Compliance Safety Management : Implement and oversee safety protocols for electrical work, ensuring compliance with national and local regulations to prevent accidents and injuries. Regulatory Compliance : Ensure all electrical installations comply with relevant codes and standards, such as the National Electrical Code (NEC) in the United States or equivalent in other countries. Communication and Documentation Project Reporting : Keep detailed records of project progress, changes, and any issues that arise. Prepare reports for project managers and other stakeholders. Documentation : Maintain accurate documentation for all electrical installations, modifications, and as-built drawings for future reference and maintenance purposes. Troubleshooting and Maintenance Problem-Solving : Diagnose and troubleshoot electrical problems during construction and provide solutions to ensure the project stays on track. Maintenance Planning : Develop and implement maintenance strategies for electrical systems to ensure their longevity and reliability. Preferred candidate profile     The profile criteria for an Electrical Site Engineer encompass a combination of educational qualifications, technical skills, experience, and personal attributes that ensure the successful oversight and management of electrical aspects in construction projects. Below are the key criteria typically sought in candidates for an Electrical Site Engineer position: Educational Qualifications Bachelor's Degree : A Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering is typically required. Some employers might accept related fields such as Electrical and Electronics Engineering, but the focus should be on electrical systems. Certifications : Not always mandatory, certifications such as a Professional Engineer (PE) license, Project Management Professional (PMP), or specific certifications in electrical design software (e.g., AutoCAD) and standards can be advantageous. Experience Years of Experience : Depending on the level of the position, employers may require anywhere from 5 to 8 years of experience in electrical engineering, specifically in a site engineer or similar role overseeing electrical installations in construction projects. Project Experience : Direct involvement in planning, designing, and implementing electrical systems in construction projects. Experience with industrial, commercial, or large-scale residential projects is often preferred. Safety and Compliance : Demonstrated experience in adhering to and enforcing safety standards and electrical codes, such as the NEC or IEC standards, depending on the region. Technical Skills Electrical Systems Knowledge : Deep understanding of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, control systems, and grounding. Design and Analysis Tools : Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit) for electrical design and simulation tools for system analysis. Project Management Tools : Familiarity with project management software (e.g., MS Project, Primavera) and MS Office Suite for reporting and documentation. Soft Skills Communication : Strong verbal and written communication skills for effective coordination with team members, contractors, and stakeholders. Problem-Solving : Ability to identify issues quickly and develop effective solutions under pressure. Leadership : Skills in leading and motivating teams, managing subcontractors, and ensuring project objectives are met. Adaptability : Flexibility to handle changing conditions on-site and adjust plans as necessary to meet project deadlines and budgets. Personal Attributes Attention to Detail : Precision in overseeing the installation and maintenance of electrical systems to ensure they meet specifications and standards. Time Management : Capability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, ensuring timely completion of each. Safety Consciousness : A strong commitment to maintaining high safety standards to protect personnel and property. Perks and benefits   As per Negotiations
column11: Team Management Skills, Coordination, Project Planning, Problem Solving, Documentation, Leadership Skills, Quality Control

What it is like to work at Sistema.bio                   Global company:        At Sistema.bio, you get exposure to working with 3 continents and diverse cultures and people. Its the opportunity to build an international career and grow as an individual!           Passion and purpose       :      Working at Sistema.bio, you work with a very passionate team that believes strongly in working for the social and environmental impact they want to see.           A growing team with growing opportunities:        Sistema.     bio is on its way to double in size in the coming years. This growth will open new roles, new countries and a world of new opportunities! We have a roll-up-your-sleeves culture    where we offer new opportunities for our team members careers and    aspirations based on their skills, interests and aspirations.           Learning about agroecology and small and medium-scale farmers       :      We make sure that regardless of your background, you get to spend time in the field with farmers and genuinely learn about farming and agroecology in general and its importance.           Work-life balance       :      At Sistema.bio, we know you re at your best when you re rested and healthy. We therefore give you generous holidays options, parental leave, we pay for your health protection and give you options to work remotely when needed and possible.           Gender Equality       : Sistema.     bio is committed to gender equality in the workplace. Thanks to our Gender policies and efforts women represent 57% of the Global team for example, and 27% of our overall workforce. We have flexible hours and expressing spaces for lactating mothers.           A team of Do ers:       We are a team of doers. You will get a chance to get your hands dirty and learn on the ground up because your ideas and execution matter.

column2: Optech Engineering is looking for Electrical Site Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journeyAs an Electrical Site Engineer, your role is to oversee and manage electrical construction projects at various sites     You will be responsible for ensuring that electrical systems are installed, operated, and maintained correctly and in accordance with project specifications and safety standards     Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:Project Planning and Design: Collaborate with project managers, architects, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and develop electrical system plans and designs     This includes determining electrical load requirements, cable routing, equipment placement, and electrical distribution design     Installation Supervision: Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of electrical systems and equipment on-site     Coordinate with electrical contractors and ensure compliance with design specifications, safety codes, and industry standards     Quality Assurance: Perform regular inspections and quality checks to ensure that electrical work is being carried out according to approved plans and standards     Identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies, ensuring that electrical systems are installed correctly and functioning properly     Safety Compliance: Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site     Ensure that electrical installations meet safety codes and regulations, and address any safety concerns promptly     Project Coordination: Coordinate with other trades and disciplines on-site to ensure proper integration and coordination of electrical systems with other construction activities     Communicate effectively with project teams and provide technical guidance as needed     Material and Equipment Management: Plan and manage the procurement, delivery, and storage of electrical materials, equipment, and tools required for the project     Ensure that inventory is maintained, and proper documentation is maintained for materials used

column2: Innovation          New ways of saving energy.          Improvements in Smart Joules energy optimization technology DeJoule          Increasing efficiency of project delivery (cost, time, manpower, etc.).          Ways to pursue the Company s Mission, Vision and Goals in line with our Core Values.          Planning:          Ensure the DeJoule Deployment Checklists are filled by the Field Engineers during Audit phase and to support the BMS manager to prepare the equipment list for project design.          Support the BMS Manager in the documentation based on the on-site planning derived from the checklists and prepare the planning documents as follows:          IO summary          Control Mapping          Installation Locations (Panels, Meters, Sensors etc.)          BOQ          High-side Schematic diagrams          Wiring Layouts          Wiring Estimations          Integration Mapping Points          Coordinate with the BMS Manager and update the plans for possible (retrofit works) on site and update the BOQ accordingly and get the planning documents verified as per the project plan and report to the manager.          DeJoule Execution:          Verify the quality of the procured materials on site and based on standard checklists, keep track of the invoices issued by vendors and forward them to the Central Services department along with the images of material received on site for confirmation.          Intimate the vendors about the rules and regulations of the site along with the work plan on site (Safety measures, Sexual harassments, Trespassing un-authorized areas etc.).          Execute the work within the project deadlines and supervise the vendor to carry out the works as per the project plan. Ensure proper wire terminations in panels and ferruling s on site.          Coordinate with BMS Manager related to installation works subjected to shutdown requirement. (e.g., Energy meter, flow meter, VFD connections and sensor installations)          Escalate unplanned deviations to BMS Managers notify the significant changes required before executing it on site. (changes in cable routing, VFD malfunctions, CCN card failures, Panel location changes etc.)          Prepare daily reports comprising of work completed, manpower that worked on site, materials consumed, duration of works and planned upcoming works for the next day based on standard formats should be reported to the BMS Manager.          DeJoule Testing and Commissioning:          erify all the ModBus devices are functional on site through means of software testing using Modscan and track the commissioning reports through means of screenshots/snapshot of ModScan reports. Similarly, use multimeters with all analog and digital communication.          Complete Point to Point testing using Joule Track for each and every readable and writable point included in the IO List, and generate a report Snag List clearly identify which I/O points are not working. Resolve the on-site snags during the testing phase.          Prepare Resistive Sensors End to End Testing Report which contains the values obtained in the Controllers end as well as sensors end.          Record the sources of each snags from the I/O List that appears in the Snag List (equipment issues, deployment issues, hardware issues, software issues, network issues, etc.).          Coordinate with the relevant teams of SJPL (Site Energy Engineers/Projects Execution Team/Technical Support, etc.) to resolve each and every snag and bring down the Default Rate to 0.          Place the IO-Sheets in the controller panels.          Prepare Network Testing Report using the Diagnostics Page as a tool and ensure network strength is more than 80 at each Controller.          Prepare the detailed commissioning report to manager with all the commissioning reports, final material installed report, with images attached in the commissioning report. (e.g. Modscans, sensors, network, Earth testing reports Joule track data reports etc.).          Coordinate with the BMS Central Team to ensure the configuration is done as desired and report in case of any deviation in the configuration plan.          BMS Handover:          Prepare and ensure all the handover documents like final IO Sheets, cable layouts, controller mappings, network architecture, cable schedule, field instrument installation locations, CAD drawings, etc. are completed before the handover to the SJPL team with 0 snags.          Train the client operators to use DeJoule with the BMS workstation provided to the client from SJPL and ensure the workstation is commissioned properly on site.          Project Execution Team and Operations Team:          Ensure support to the Project Execution team and BMS design commissioning team for deployment of DeJoule at the site in parallel with new equipment.          Support the Site Energy Engineers/Project Managers to understand the use of DeJoule through basic training exercises for effective use of DeJoule on sites.          Leadership:          Reinforce the Company s Mission, Vision and Core Values and ensure adherence to company policies throughout the operations team.          Contributions to improving the company s culture and policies, and to overall company planning in line with our Mission and Vision.          Preparation of daily/weekly targets for all project execution related activities, and managing overall work of all project managers in their region.          Coordinating with the purchase department and BMS Central Team for evaluation and induction of high-quality vendors for project execution in their regions.          Participate and plan induction programs of other team members in Smart Joules, as needed.          Provide training induction programs for new joiners in the BMS team, and modules for other relevant team members. Constantly groom and train BMS team members, and track their learning and skill levels to ensure continuous improvement and learning.        03      03    Skills Qualifications      1-4 years of hands on experience on installation testing and commissioning of field instruments such as DDC controllers, temperature sensors, flow meters, pressure sensors, motorized control valve, instrumentation cables, VFD and control panel          Bachelor s Degree or Higher in Electrical/ Instrumentation/ Power Systems/ Electronic Engineering.          Basic Knowledge chillers, HVAC pumps, cooling tower, AHU, heat pumps, energy meters, BMS controllers and sensors          Strong knowledge of different communication protocol like RS485 (Modbus), BACnet, LONwork, LAN, Ethernet, etc.          Basic knowledge on operation of VFDs and executed the experience on executing BMS projects independently or under supervision by Project managers with minimal guidance.          Strong computer skills (Web Search, Email, Word, Excel, Power Point)          Communication: Must speak English and Must be able to make effective presentations to a variety of audiences.          Should have basic knowledge in BMS and Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning equipment like Chillers, Pumps, Cooling Towers and AHUs.

column2: We are seeking an experienced Servo Sales & Service Engineer with expertise in industrial hydraulics and a strong orientation towards Servo Sales & Service. The ideal candidate will have extensive industry connections and a track record of fostering service relationships and developing business opportunities. Key Responsibilities: 4-6 years of experience in installation. Commissioning & maintenance of Tablet Compression Machines, pharmaceuticals equipment for solid oral dosage and related accessories. Should have in depth knowledge of installation, commissioning & maintenance of the machineries with electrical/instrumentation, pneumatic controls & should have exposure on mechanical erection activities. Knowledge with PLC operated machineries will be added advantage. Must have to troubleshoot & resolve issues Should be able read & understand mechanical drawings, plant layout, GA drawings of equipment, P&ID diagram, Utility schedule, Electrical schematic drawing etc. Knowledge of ATEX hazardous locations is desirable but not required. The candidate must be able to generate reports & other required paperwork during execution & after completion of project Should be able to coordinate with Service in Charge/Supervisor, project manager & other staff at customer end to complete the on-going project efficiently Should be able to communicate English - verbal and written Excellent Team Player Must possess electrical/mechanical trouble shooting skills Working knowledge of Static/rotating machinery, pneumatics, hydraulics, and machine assembly Basic knowledge of electrical drives, industrial controls, and instrumentation Ability to interpret electrical schematics & mechanical drawings Degree or Diploma in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering Design and implement hydraulic solutions for both mobile and industrial applications. Actively develop and nurture OEM client relationships, understanding their specific needs and delivering custom solutions. Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure the delivery of high-quality and innovative hydraulic systems. Provide expert technical guidance and support to clients. Conduct thorough testing and validation of hydraulic systems in various environments. Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in hydraulic technologies. Partner with sales and marketing teams to leverage industry connections and drive business growth.  Qualifications:  Bachelors or Master?? degree in Electrical Engineering, Hydraulic Engineering, or a related field.  Substantial experience in hydraulic systems, encompassing both mobile and industrial applications.  Proven track record in Servo Service with strong industry connections.  In-depth knowledge of fluid mechanics, hydraulic components, and system design and PLC .  Excellent problem-solving abilities and technical skills.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  Willingness to travel both domestically and internationally. We Offer:  A dynamic, international, and growth-oriented work environment.  Opportunities for professional development and career progression.  Competitive salary and benefits package.  A chance to be a part of a company setting global benchmarks in the hydraulic industry. How to Apply: If you are driven by innovation and wish to contribute to a globally emerging hydraulic brand, please send your resume and a cover letter highlighting your industry experience and achievements in Servo Service to info@thmhuade.com THM Huade Hydraulics is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce.

column1: Sr. Medium Voltage and Low Voltage Electrical Engineer
column2: Support the preparation of the preliminary plant design of the collection system and low voltage system for renewable energy facilities including wind farms, PV plants and Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) projects.      Support in the management of electrical engineering contractors assigned to work on the design of the plant, including definition of requirements and specifications, review of engineering drawings and RFI management.      Maintain and optimize plant engineering design criteria and technical specifications for all equipment and works involved in the constructions of the plant.      Support the contractual negotiation with electrical engineering contractors regarding general technical areas such as engineering, equipment specifications, performance/testing schedules, etc.      Support and conduct engineering analysis of new technologies and performance evaluation.      Manage and coordination of external consultants to complete the internal assessments.      Undertake site visits internationally to ensure technically the quality of the plant at different stages of the project, from construction to commissioning.    Support the development of tools and procedures for ensuring consistency, quality and optimize design cost.      Optimize design to maximize ROI.      Provide engineering consulting support to project managers in the preliminary design and engineering of the plant.      Provide engineering consulting support to other areas of the organization, including O&M and Power Marketing.      Conduct plant equipment technical review and specifications including PV modules, inverters (solar and storage), wind turbines, BESS containers, trackers, and up to some extend switchgears, cables, transformers, other MV/HV equipment.      Develop and maintain electrical specifications and requirements to define Acciona standards to contractors. Ensure consistency with Acciona Corporate specifications.      Contribute to the electrical Safety in Design process for all Acciona projects in development and engineering.      Ensure compliance of self and others on site during construction with federal, state, and local laws and with Acciona s safety and environmental standards, policies and practices.      Oversee the electrical tests performed by Construction Team on site prior to and during the commissioning of the renewable energy facilities. Support the QA/QC team on site.      Provide electrical technical interface to support Procurement. Oversee the factory testing of the major electrical equipment to be installed at the renewable energy facilities.      Evaluate electrical equipment and material proposals; prepare bid tab evaluations for electrical equipment.      Assist with management of the Non-Conformity and the Quality Audit programs.      Be on-site for first energization of the collection system and first generator synchronization.      Review and comment on the scope of work on electrical contracts.      Assist with receiving and inspecting of the major pieces of electrical equipment.      Follow Companys processes and procedures to safely and effectively design and test Acciona renewable generating facilities for Best in Class Performance.      Maintain a current understanding of renewable generation technology by participating in various training opportunities and reading Acciona and industry documents and publications as well as participating in other professional development activities.      Create the weekly and monthly reporting requirements for our internal and external customers, as well as KPI reporting.      Other responsibilities as assigned.          Required Skills and Competencies          Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering required, P.E license a plus.    5 years of experience in utility or power plant design preferred.      Excellent communications skills, with the ability to provide training on complex operations.      Familiarity with PV, wind and BESS industry and systems including working knowledge of modules, inverters technologies, tracking systems, energy storage technologies, transformers, cabling.      Good knowledge of the main players in the industry (EPCs, third party labs, etc)      Experience of large-scale PV plant design, construction and commissioning.      Experience on the preparation of PV, wind and BESS Basic Design package for the Medium Voltage and Low Voltage scope and EPC Detail Design reviews. specifications and safety standards     Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:Project Planning and Design: Collaborate with project managers, architects, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and develop electrical system plans and designs     This includes determining electrical load requirements, cable routing, equipment placement, and electrical distribution design     Installation Supervision: Oversee the installation, testing, and commissioning of electrical systems and equipment on-site     Coordinate with electrical contractors and ensure compliance with design specifications, safety codes, and industry standards     Quality Assurance: Perform regular inspections and quality checks to ensure that electrical work is being Compliance: Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel on-site     Ensure that electrical installations meet safety codes and column2: Role & responsibilities     Electrical Site Engineers play a crucial role in construction projects, especially those involving significant electrical work. They ensure that all electrical installations and systems are designed, implemented, and maintained according to specifications, codes, and standards. Heres a detailed look at the roles and responsibilities of an Electrical Site Engineer: Project Planning and Design Review and Interpretation : Analyze project plans and specifications to understand electrical requirements. Review and interpret electrical diagrams, blueprints, and other technical documents. Design Oversight : Oversee or assist in the design of electrical systems, ensuring they meet project requirements, safety standards, and regulatory compliance. Implementation and Execution Site Supervision : Supervise the installation of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, fire alarm systems, and other related components. Coordination : Work closely with other engineers, architects, and construction team members to ensure electrical systems are integrated smoothly with other aspects of the construction project. Quality Assurance : Conduct quality control checks to ensure that the installation of electrical systems adheres to plans, specifications, codes, and safety standards. Material Management : Manage and procure electrical materials and equipment, ensuring they are available when needed and meet project specifications. Safety and Compliance Safety Management : Implement and oversee safety protocols for electrical work, ensuring compliance with national and local regulations to prevent accidents and injuries. Regulatory Compliance : Ensure all electrical installations comply with relevant codes and standards, such as the National Electrical Code (NEC) in the United States or equivalent in other countries. Communication and Documentation Project Reporting : Keep detailed records of project progress, changes, and any issues that arise. Prepare reports for project managers and other stakeholders. Documentation : Maintain accurate documentation for all electrical installations, modifications, and as-built drawings for future reference and maintenance purposes. Troubleshooting and Maintenance Problem-Solving : Diagnose and troubleshoot electrical problems during construction and provide solutions to ensure the project stays on track. Maintenance Planning : Develop and implement maintenance strategies for electrical systems to ensure their longevity and reliability. Preferred candidate profile     The profile criteria for an Electrical Site Engineer encompass a combination of educational qualifications, technical skills, experience, and personal attributes that ensure the successful oversight and management of electrical aspects in construction projects. Below are the key criteria typically sought in candidates for an Electrical Site Engineer position: Educational Qualifications Bachelor's Degree : A Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering is typically required. Some employers might accept related fields such as Electrical and Electronics Engineering, but the focus should be on electrical systems. Certifications : Not always mandatory, certifications such as a Professional Engineer (PE) license, Project Management Professional (PMP), or specific certifications in electrical design software (e.g., AutoCAD) and standards can be advantageous. Experience Years of Experience : Depending on the level of the position, employers may require anywhere from 5 to 8 years of experience in electrical engineering, specifically in a site engineer or similar role overseeing electrical installations in construction projects. Project Experience : Direct involvement in planning, designing, and implementing electrical systems in construction projects. Experience with industrial, commercial, or large-scale residential projects is often preferred. Safety and Compliance : Demonstrated experience in adhering to and enforcing safety standards and electrical codes, such as the NEC or IEC standards, depending on the region. Technical Skills Electrical Systems Knowledge : Deep understanding of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, control systems, and grounding. Design and Analysis Tools : Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit) for electrical design and simulation tools for system analysis. Project Management Tools : Familiarity with project management software (e.g., MS Project, Primavera) and MS Office Suite for reporting and documentation. Soft Skills Communication : Strong verbal and written communication skills for effective coordination with team members, contractors, and stakeholders. Problem-Solving : Ability to identify issues quickly and develop effective solutions under pressure. Leadership : Skills in leading and motivating teams, managing subcontractors, and ensuring project objectives are met. Adaptability : Flexibility to handle changing conditions on-site and adjust plans as necessary to meet project deadlines and budgets. Personal Attributes Attention to Detail : Precision in overseeing the installation and maintenance of electrical systems to ensure they meet specifications and standards. Time Management : Capability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, ensuring timely completion of each. Safety Consciousness : A strong commitment to maintaining high safety standards to protect personnel and property. Perks and benefits   As per Negotiations
column11: Team Management Skills, Coordination, Project Planning, Problem Solving, Documentation, Leadership Skills, Quality Control

column2: This Senior Electrical Engineer position will fulfill an on-site role at a Microsoft datacenter campus supporting ongoing construction activities        This role will serve as a daily on-site presence to review progress and support quality design of multiple concurrent datacenter builds      The position will be responsible for monitoring progress for compliance with construction documents from initial stages through commissioning and work closely with the engineering, procurement, controls and construction teams      Additionally, this role will provide project management, technical direction, decision-making and overall leadership on behalf of engineering throughout the construction lifecycle up to and including the turnover to Microsoft Datacenter Operations          As such they        will    support multi-discipline coordination, issue identification and resolution, continuous improvement efforts,    a    nd the ongoing documentation of project learnings for incorporation into future designs               Required/Minimum Qualifications:                  8+ years of electrical engineering experience              OR Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field AND 5+ years of electrical engineering experience              OR Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field AND 3+ years of electrical engineering experience                  Minimum 5 years experience specific to datacenter electrical engineering.              Experience reviewing construction drawings, project specifications, and equipment submittals against construction activities to track progress and review potential issues.              Experience with the design and operation of electrical systems, power distribution systems, backup power systems, electrical power monitoring systems, the control diagrams, sequence of operation for the electrical controls systems, overall network architecture and communication protocols.                          Other Requirements:              Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.                      Additional or Preferred Qualifications:                  Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field AND 8+ years of electrical engineering experience              OR Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, or related field AND 6+ years of electrical engineering experience.                  Minimum of 10 years of experience with mission critical or high-tech industry projects.              Registered Professional Electrical Engineer.                                  Core Responsibilities:                Serve as the on-site electrical engineering and project management representative throughout construction of a multi-year datacenter campus development.          Perform regular site walks and site inspections to observe progress, review construction versus design intent, review all benchmarking to ensure standard and quality are met, and flag potential concerns for engineering review.          Facilitate and participate in a close working relationship with all Microsoft site personnel attending construction-based quality and assurance meetings, attend schedule and milestone review sessions, close monitoring of overall project management, Electrical, and        Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (        EPMS) related risk items with the Architectural Engineering (AE) subject matter experts (SMEs)          Review construction drawings, specifications, design guides/standards, sequences of operation, and commissioning documents for technical compliance.          Support and oversight of submittal review, Request For Invoice (RFI) responses, and commissioning activities.          Facilitate timely response and enable seamless project execution.            Possess a high level of understanding of commercial and industrial architecture and engineering with a primary focus on datacenter design.              Knowledge of construction techniques and terminology including the ability to read and interpret construction drawings and requirements documents is essential.              Working knowledge of Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS)              Must possess excellent leadership competencies and a willingness to collaborate and work cross- functionally to maximize business results and positive customer experiences.              Exhibit excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills to be used at varying levels of business up to and including business executives.              Able to work with other technical and non-technical groups in a fast-paced environment and do so with an even temperament.

column2: Job Title: Electrical Engineer Company Overview:   :  Greencentric Commercial projects is a leading turnkey interior  firm specializing in creating innovative and functional spaces for both commercial and residential clients. With a focus on excellence and creativity, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional design solutions that exceed our clients' expectations. Job Overview:  As an Electrical Engineer at Greencentric Commercial Projects, you will play a vital role in the design, implementation, and management of electrical systems for our projects. Your expertise in 2D drafting, AutoCAD, and electrical engineering principles will be instrumental in ensuring the successful completion of our projects on time and within budget. Key Responsibilities: 2D Drafting:  Proficient in AutoCAD 2D to create accurate technical drawings, schematics, and layouts for electrical systems. SLD (Single Line Diagram) Preparation:  Develop SLDs to illustrate the electrical connections and components. Lighting Layout Preparation:  Design lighting layouts for interior and exterior spaces, ensuring optimal illumination and energy efficiency. As-Built Drawing Preparation:  Prepare as-built drawings based on actual site conditions, documenting any modifications or deviations from the original design. Site Visits:  Conduct regular site visits to oversee electrical installations, verify compliance with design specifications, and address any on-site issues or changes. Bill of Quantities (BOQ) Preparation:  Create detailed BOQs outlining the quantities and specifications of electrical materials and equipment required for each project. Bill Verification and On-Site Bill Preparation:  Review contractor bills and invoices, verify the accuracy of charges, and prepare on-site bills as necessary. Certification and Verification of Vendor Bills:  Certify and verify vendor bills for electrical materials and services provided, ensuring adherence to contractual agreements and project budgets. Estimation and Costing:  Estimate the costs associated with electrical installations, including materials, labor, and overhead expenses. MS Excel Proficiency:  Utilize MS Excel for data analysis, cost tracking, and project management purposes. Efficient Client Communication:  Maintain effective communication with clients, contractors, and project stakeholders to provide updates, address concerns, and ensure client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle. Qualifications: Diploma in Electrical Engineering (Junior Engineer) or BE Electrical (Senior Engineer) from a recognized institution. Proven experience (2-5 years) working as an Electrical Engineer in the construction or engineering industry. Strong knowledge of electrical engineering principles, codes, and standards. Proficiency in AutoCAD 2D and other relevant design software. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently. Proficiency in MS Excel and other Microsoft Office applications. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Location:  Andheri East, Marol, Mumbai Benefits: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications. Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. Collaborative and supportive work environment with a focus on innovation and growth. Join Greencentric Commercial Projects and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to delivering exceptional electrical engineering solutions. Apply now to embark on an exciting career as an Electrical Engineer!

What it is like to work at Sistema.bio                   Global company:        At Sistema.bio, you get exposure to working with 3 continents and diverse cultures and people. Its the opportunity to build an international career and grow as an individual!           Passion and purpose       :      Working at Sistema.bio, you work with a very passionate team that believes strongly in working for the social and environmental impact they want to see.           A growing team with growing opportunities:        Sistema.     bio is on its way to double in size in the coming years. This growth will open new roles, new countries and a world of new opportunities! We have a roll-up-your-sleeves culture    where we offer new opportunities for our team members careers and    aspirations based on their skills, interests and aspirations.           Learning about agroecology and small and medium-scale farmers       :      We make sure that regardless of your background, you get to spend time in the field with farmers and genuinely learn about farming and agroecology in general and its importance.           Work-life balance       :      At Sistema.bio, we know you re at your best when you re rested and healthy. We therefore give you generous holidays options, parental leave, we pay for your health protection and give you options to work remotely when needed and possible.           Gender Equality       : Sistema.     bio is committed to gender equality in the workplace. Thanks to our Gender policies and efforts women represent 57% of the Global team for example, and 27% of our overall workforce. We have flexible hours and expressing spaces for lactating mothers.           A team of Do ers:       We are a team of doers. You will get a chance to get your hands dirty and learn on the ground up because your ideas and execution matter.

column2: Innovation          New ways of saving energy.          Improvements in Smart Joules energy optimization technology DeJoule          Increasing efficiency of project delivery (cost, time, manpower, etc.).          Ways to pursue the Company s Mission, Vision and Goals in line with our Core Values.          Planning:          Ensure the DeJoule Deployment Checklists are filled by the Field Engineers during Audit phase and to support the BMS manager to prepare the equipment list for project design.          Support the BMS Manager in the documentation based on the on-site planning derived from the checklists and prepare the planning documents as follows:          IO summary          Control Mapping          Installation Locations (Panels, Meters, Sensors etc.)          BOQ          High-side Schematic diagrams          Wiring Layouts          Wiring Estimations          Integration Mapping Points          Coordinate with the BMS Manager and update the plans for possible (retrofit works) on site and update the BOQ accordingly and get the planning documents verified as per the project plan and report to the manager.          DeJoule Execution:          Verify the quality of the procured materials on site and based on standard checklists, keep track of the invoices issued by vendors and forward them to the Central Services department along with the images of material received on site for confirmation.          Intimate the vendors about the rules and regulations of the site along with the work plan on site (Safety measures, Sexual harassments, Trespassing un-authorized areas etc.).          Execute the work within the project deadlines and supervise the vendor to carry out the works as per the project plan. Ensure proper wire terminations in panels and ferruling s on site.          Coordinate with BMS Manager related to installation works subjected to shutdown requirement. (e.g., Energy meter, flow meter, VFD connections and sensor installations)          Escalate unplanned deviations to BMS Managers notify the significant changes required before executing it on site. (changes in cable routing, VFD malfunctions, CCN card failures, Panel location changes etc.)          Prepare daily reports comprising of work completed, manpower that worked on site, materials consumed, duration of works and planned upcoming works for the next day based on standard formats should be reported to the BMS Manager.          DeJoule Testing and Commissioning:          erify all the ModBus devices are functional on site through means of software testing using Modscan and track the commissioning reports through means of screenshots/snapshot of ModScan reports. Similarly, use multimeters with all analog and digital communication.          Complete Point to Point testing using Joule Track for each and every readable and writable point included in the IO List, and generate a report Snag List clearly identify which I/O points are not working. Resolve the on-site snags during the testing phase.          Prepare Resistive Sensors End to End Testing Report which contains the values obtained in the Controllers end as well as sensors end.          Record the sources of each snags from the I/O List that appears in the Snag List (equipment issues, deployment issues, hardware issues, software issues, network issues, etc.).          Coordinate with the relevant teams of SJPL (Site Energy Engineers/Projects Execution Team/Technical Support, etc.) to resolve each and every snag and bring down the Default Rate to 0.          Place the IO-Sheets in the controller panels.          Prepare Network Testing Report using the Diagnostics Page as a tool and ensure network strength is more than 80 at each Controller.          Prepare the detailed commissioning report to manager with all the commissioning reports, final material installed report, with images attached in the commissioning report. (e.g. Modscans, sensors, network, Earth testing reports Joule track data reports etc.).          Coordinate with the BMS Central Team to ensure the configuration is done as desired and report in case of any deviation in the configuration plan.          BMS Handover:          Prepare and ensure all the handover documents like final IO Sheets, cable layouts, controller mappings, network architecture, cable schedule, field instrument installation locations, CAD drawings, etc. are completed before the handover to the SJPL team with 0 snags.          Train the client operators to use DeJoule with the BMS workstation provided to the client from SJPL and ensure the workstation is commissioned properly on site.          Project Execution Team and Operations Team:          Ensure support to the Project Execution team and BMS design commissioning team for deployment of DeJoule at the site in parallel with new equipment.          Support the Site Energy Engineers/Project Managers to understand the use of DeJoule through basic training exercises for effective use of DeJoule on sites.          Leadership:          Reinforce the Company s Mission, Vision and Core Values and ensure adherence to company policies throughout the operations team.          Contributions to improving the company s culture and policies, and to overall company planning in line with our Mission and Vision.          Preparation of daily/weekly targets for all project execution related activities, and managing overall work of all project managers in their region.          Coordinating with the purchase department and BMS Central Team for evaluation and induction of high-quality vendors for project execution in their regions.          Participate and plan induction programs of other team members in Smart Joules, as needed.          Provide training induction programs for new joiners in the BMS team, and modules for other relevant team members. Constantly groom and train BMS team members, and track their learning and skill levels to ensure continuous improvement and learning.        03      03    Skills Qualifications      1-4 years of hands on experience on installation testing and commissioning of field instruments such as DDC controllers, temperature sensors, flow meters, pressure sensors, motorized control valve, instrumentation cables, VFD and control panel          Bachelor s Degree or Higher in Electrical/ Instrumentation/ Power Systems/ Electronic Engineering.          Basic Knowledge chillers, HVAC pumps, cooling tower, AHU, heat pumps, energy meters, BMS controllers and sensors          Strong knowledge of different communication protocol like RS485 (Modbus), BACnet, LONwork, LAN, Ethernet, etc.          Basic knowledge on operation of VFDs and executed the experience on executing BMS projects independently or under supervision by Project managers with minimal guidance. column2: Develops electrical projects by studying customer requirements; researching and testing manufacturing and assembly methods and materials.         Develops processes by designing and modifying equipment for electrical components; soliciting observations from Team         Assures product quality by designing electrical testing methods; testing finished products and system capabilities.         Prepares product reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing information and trends.         Provides engineering information by answering questions and requests.         Maintains product and company reputation by complying with federal and state regulations.         Keeps equipment operational by following manufacturers instructions and established procedures; requesting repair service.         Completes projects by training and guiding technicians.         Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.         Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.         Perform detailed calculations to establish standards and specifications         Inspect installations and observe operations to ensure compliance with design and equipment specifications and safety standards         Use computer-assisted engineering software (AutoCAD) to perform engineering tasks         Support manufacturing department with product development and testing         Provide quality assurance for ongoing projects         Keep current with the latest technical innovations in electrical engineering         Inspect completed installations and observe operations, to ensure conformance to design and equipment specifications and compliance with operational and safety standards.         Plan and implement research methodology and procedures to apply principles of electrical theory to engineering projects.         Prepare specifications for purchase of materials and equipment.         Supervise and train project team members as necessary.         Investigate and test vendors and competitors products.         Oversee project production efforts to assure projects are completed satisfactorily, on time and within budget.         Prepare and study technical drawings, specifications of electrical systems, and topographical maps to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements.         Investigate customer or public complaints, determine nature and extent of problem, and recommend remedial measures.         Plan layout of electric power generating plants and distribution lines and stations.         Develop budgets, estimating labour, material costs.         Compile data and write reports regarding existing and potential engineering studies and projects.         Conduct field surveys and study maps, graphs, diagrams, and other data to identify and correct power system problems.         Speaking and listening to other engineers, team members and project managers, giving instructions to technicians and the ability to clearly communicate ideas and designs is essential.         As technology changes, electrical engineers need a habit of lifelong learning to keep up with innovation.         Electrical engineers work as part of a team with other engineers, technicians, project managers and report to upper management. Being a team player helps get the job done.         Ensuring projects meet safety regulations.         Maintaining project documentation.       Min Qualification: Diploma/B.Tech     Min Experience: 2-3 Years in same field
